headline: Credit Spreads Haven’t Looked This Good Since the 2000s. Can They Get Better?
summary: Companies took advantage of favorable financing conditions this year to issue debt at levels not seen since the pandemic, adding cash to the balance sheet to pay for future refinancing needs and other projects.  Underpinning the surge in debt issuance: credit spreads, a metric that finance chiefs watch when deciding when to pull the trigger on a bond sale.  Whether debt issuance remains as strong in 2025 will depend in part on whether spreads remain attractive, advisers said.
